preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

preprocess_audit.input:
# Business Requirements Document (BRD)
Project Title
**Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions**
Objective
The objective of this project is to automate the requirement gathering, documentation, and
validation process using LLM-powered agents that:
- Ingest unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs)
- Interpret context and extract relevant information
- Generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications
- Ensure regulatory compliance and traceability
- Integrate outputs into enterprise tools (e.g., Jira)
High-Level Architecture
[Architecture diagram removed for plain text formatting]
Components & Tech Stack
1. **Input Layer**
   - Meeting transcripts (audio -> text via Whisper or AWS Transcribe)
   - Emails (.eml parsing via email module)
   - PDFs/DOCX (via PyPDF2, python-docx)
   - Web scraping for regulatory documents
2. **Agents**
   - IngestorAgent: Extracts text from source files
   - ParserAgent: Filters and segments relevant content
   - ContextAgent: Extracts stakeholders, goals, risks
   - RequirementAgent: Generates user stories, specs
   - ComplianceAgent: Validates against internal policy docs   - ValidationAgent: Routes output to SMEs for feedback
   - TraceAgent: Logs all transformations for auditing
3. **Memory & Reasoning**
   - Short-term memory: In-session context
   - Long-term memory: Vector DB (Chroma, FAISS) for RAG
4. **Tools & APIs**
   - OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude
   - Jira API (atlassian-python-api)
   - Email integrations (SMTP/SendGrid)
   - Vector store for document retrieval
5. **Orchestration Framework**
   - LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows
Sample Flow: PDF to Jira
1. Upload policy PDF
2. IngestorAgent extracts text
3. ContextAgent identifies context elements
4. RequirementAgent generates structured requirements
5. ComplianceAgent validates alignment with policies
6. TraceAgent logs all steps
7. Result pushed to Jira
Security & Compliance
- PII redaction & anonymization pre-step
- Audit logs stored in append-only DB or JSON
- Role-based SME validation loop
- Secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environmentsBenefits
- Accelerates requirements capture
- Ensures consistent formatting and compliance
- Maintains traceability and audit readiness
- Reduces manual SME effort by 70%+
MVP Goals
- Upload PDF/email transcript
- Auto-generate 3 user stories + acceptance criteria
- Push to Jira
- Store logs in a dashboard
Compliance Rules
|---|---|---|---|---|
| R1 | All unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs) must be ingested and interpreted by the AI
system. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R2 | The AI system must generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R3 | The AI system must ensure regulatory compliance and traceability. | Legal | High | GDPR,
ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R4 | The AI system's outputs must be integrated into enterprise tools like Jira. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R5 | The AI system must have a secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environments. | Security | High
| ISO/IEC 27001, GDPR |
| R6 | The AI system must redact and anonymize PII data. | Security | High | GDPR |
| R7 | The AI system must store audit logs in an append-only DB or JSON. | Security | High | ISO/IEC
27001, GDPR || R8 | The AI system must have a role-based SME validation loop. | Operational | Medium | ISO/IEC
27001 |
| R9 | The AI system must reduce manual SME effort by at least 70%. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R10 | The AI system must be able to upload PDF/email transcript. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R11 | The AI system must auto-generate at least 3 user stories + acceptance criteria. |
Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R12 | The AI system must push generated user stories to Jira. | Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001
|
| R13 | The AI system must store logs in a dashboard. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |

- Summary of Action: The 'preprocess' agent has taken the input Business Requirements Document (BRD) and performed text cleaning and segmentation. It also extracted entities from the document, such as organizations, products, and cardinal numbers. The output includes a cleaned text version of the BRD and a list of identified segments and entities.
- User Involved: Not specified in the action details.
- Risk Flags: Low. The action involves text processing and entity extraction, which are standard practices in data handling. However, the absence of specific user information and access control details could be a minor concern.
- Recommendations (if any): Ensure that access control measures are in place to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive documents. Implement transparency measures to log user actions and access to the preprocessing agent. Verify that the preprocessing aligns with data handling best practices, especially concerning PII redaction and anonymization.
- Timestamp: Not provided in the action details.

summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
summarize_audit.output:
Key Points:
- Project: Digital Loan Application and Approval System by XYZ Bank
- Objective: Create an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, complete KYC requirements, track application status, and receive approval digitally.
- Features: Include online application form, integration with CIBIL for credit score, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC document verification, loan sanction via OTP, and integration with core banking for disbursement.
- Stakeholders: Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head - Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
- Timeline: From requirements finalization on 15 March 2025 to go-live on 1 July 2025.

Actions:
- Finalize requirements by 15 March 2025
- Kick off development by 1 April 2025
- Complete UAT by 1 June 2025
- Move system to go-live on 1 July 2025

Blockers: 
- Potential delay in API access to credit bureau
- Resistance from customers reluctant to use the digital onboarding process
- Possible changes to compliance requirements due to upcoming RBI guidelines.  

Success Metrics: 
- Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours
- 80% reduction in manual data entry
- 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL

 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status

3. The scope includes the implementation of various features such as credit score fetching from credit bureaus, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC document verification, loan sanction via OTP authentication, and integration with core banking for disbursement.
4. Stakeholders include the Product Manager, Business Head - Retail Lending, IT Manager, and Compliance Lead.
5. Assumptions include customers having Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers, system support for English and Hindi, and loan disbursement only through verified bank accounts.
6. Risks identified are delay in API access to credit bureau, resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding, and potential compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.
7. Key timelines include requirement finalization by 15 March 2025, development commencement by 1 April 2025, UAT by 1 June 2025, and going live by 1 July 2025.
8. Success metrics include a reduced TAT from 5 days to 2 hours, 80% reduction in manual data entry, and 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.

2. Begin development by 1 April 2025.
3. Conduct UAT by 1 June 2025.
4. Prepare for project launch on 1 July 2025.

Blockers:
1. Potential delay in acquiring API access to credit bureau.
2. Resistance from customers who are not comfortable with digital onboarding.
3. Potential changes in compliance requirements due to the new RBI guidelines.

Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025

 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

 Business Objectives

 Non-functional Requirements

summarize_audit.input:
# Business Requirements Document (BRD)
Project Title
**Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions**
Objective
The objective of this project is to automate the requirement gathering, documentation, and
validation process using LLM-powered agents that:
- Ingest unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs)
- Interpret context and extract relevant information
- Generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications
- Ensure regulatory compliance and traceability
- Integrate outputs into enterprise tools (e.g., Jira)
High-Level Architecture
[Architecture diagram removed for plain text formatting]
Components & Tech Stack
1. **Input Layer**
   - Meeting transcripts (audio -> text via Whisper or AWS Transcribe)
   - Emails (.eml parsing via email module)
   - PDFs/DOCX (via PyPDF2, python-docx)
   - Web scraping for regulatory documents
2. **Agents**
   - IngestorAgent: Extracts text from source files
   - ParserAgent: Filters and segments relevant content
   - ContextAgent: Extracts stakeholders, goals, risks
   - RequirementAgent: Generates user stories, specs
   - ComplianceAgent: Validates against internal policy docs   - ValidationAgent: Routes output to SMEs for feedback
   - TraceAgent: Logs all transformations for auditing
3. **Memory & Reasoning**
   - Short-term memory: In-session context
   - Long-term memory: Vector DB (Chroma, FAISS) for RAG
4. **Tools & APIs**
   - OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude
   - Jira API (atlassian-python-api)
   - Email integrations (SMTP/SendGrid)
   - Vector store for document retrieval
5. **Orchestration Framework**
   - LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows
Sample Flow: PDF to Jira
1. Upload policy PDF
2. IngestorAgent extracts text
3. ContextAgent identifies context elements
4. RequirementAgent generates structured requirements
5. ComplianceAgent validates alignment with policies
6. TraceAgent logs all steps
7. Result pushed to Jira
Security & Compliance
- PII redaction & anonymization pre-step
- Audit logs stored in append-only DB or JSON
- Role-based SME validation loop
- Secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environmentsBenefits
- Accelerates requirements capture
- Ensures consistent formatting and compliance
- Maintains traceability and audit readiness
- Reduces manual SME effort by 70%+
MVP Goals
- Upload PDF/email transcript
- Auto-generate 3 user stories + acceptance criteria
- Push to Jira
- Store logs in a dashboard
Compliance Rules
|---|---|---|---|---|
| R1 | All unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs) must be ingested and interpreted by the AI
system. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R2 | The AI system must generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R3 | The AI system must ensure regulatory compliance and traceability. | Legal | High | GDPR,
ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R4 | The AI system's outputs must be integrated into enterprise tools like Jira. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R5 | The AI system must have a secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environments. | Security | High
| ISO/IEC 27001, GDPR |
| R6 | The AI system must redact and anonymize PII data. | Security | High | GDPR |
| R7 | The AI system must store audit logs in an append-only DB or JSON. | Security | High | ISO/IEC
27001, GDPR || R8 | The AI system must have a role-based SME validation loop. | Operational | Medium | ISO/IEC
27001 |
| R9 | The AI system must reduce manual SME effort by at least 70%. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R10 | The AI system must be able to upload PDF/email transcript. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R11 | The AI system must auto-generate at least 3 user stories + acceptance criteria. |
Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R12 | The AI system must push generated user stories to Jira. | Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001
|
| R13 | The AI system must store logs in a dashboard. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
summarize_audit.output:
**Key Points:**

- The project is to create an AI system to automate requirement gathering, documentation, and validation process in financial institutions.
- The AI system will be able to ingest and interpret unstructured data, generate formal requirements or user stories, ensures regulatory compliance and traceability, and integrates outputs to enterprise tools such as Jira.
- The high-level architecture includes components such as input layer, agents, memory and reasoning, tools and APIs, and an orchestration framework.
- Security and compliance will be ensured through PII redaction and anonymization, storing audit logs in an append-only DB or JSON, role-based SME validation loop, and secure deployment.
- The MVP goals include uploading PDF/email transcript, auto-generating 3 user stories + acceptance criteria, pushing output to Jira, and storing logs in a dashboard.

**Actions:**

- Develop different agents (IngestorAgent, ParserAgent, ContextAgent, RequirementAgent, ComplianceAgent, ValidationAgent, TraceAgent) for specific functions.
- Integrate with enterprise tools (OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude, Jira API, Email integrations, Vector store).
- Set up the orchestration framework (LangChain or CrewAI).
- Incorporate security measures into the system.
- Develop the MVP to meet the stated goals.

**Blockers:**

- No clear blockers are mentioned. However, the complexity and breadth of the AI system may present challenges in terms of time, resources, and skills requirements. Compliance and security aspects may also require close attention to detail and rigorous measures to ensure all requirements are met.
summarize_audit.audit_summary:

This involves creating various specialized agents, integrating with enterprise tools, setting up an orchestration framework, and incorporating security measures. The MVP goals include uploading transcripts, auto-generating user stories, pushing outputs to Jira, and storing logs in a dashboard.
- User Involved: Not specified in the provided details.
- Risk Flags: Medium. While the action aligns with best practices in terms of transparency, data handling, and access control, the complexity of the AI system and the need for rigorous compliance and security measures present potential risks.
- Recommendations (if any): 
  - Ensure thorough testing and validation of each agent to confirm functionality and compliance.
  - Implement robust security protocols to protect sensitive data and maintain privacy.
  - Regularly review and update compliance measures to align with evolving regulations.
  - Allocate sufficient resources and expertise to address potential challenges in system development and deployment.
- Timestamp: Not provided in the action details.

summarize_audit.input:
# Business Requirements Document (BRD)
Project Title
**Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions**
Objective
The objective of this project is to automate the requirement gathering, documentation, and
validation process using LLM-powered agents that:
- Ingest unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs)
- Interpret context and extract relevant information
- Generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications
- Ensure regulatory compliance and traceability
- Integrate outputs into enterprise tools (e.g., Jira)
High-Level Architecture
[Architecture diagram removed for plain text formatting]
Components & Tech Stack
1. **Input Layer**
   - Meeting transcripts (audio -> text via Whisper or AWS Transcribe)
   - Emails (.eml parsing via email module)
   - PDFs/DOCX (via PyPDF2, python-docx)
   - Web scraping for regulatory documents
2. **Agents**
   - IngestorAgent: Extracts text from source files
   - ParserAgent: Filters and segments relevant content
   - ContextAgent: Extracts stakeholders, goals, risks
   - RequirementAgent: Generates user stories, specs
   - ComplianceAgent: Validates against internal policy docs   - ValidationAgent: Routes output to SMEs for feedback
   - TraceAgent: Logs all transformations for auditing
3. **Memory & Reasoning**
   - Short-term memory: In-session context
   - Long-term memory: Vector DB (Chroma, FAISS) for RAG
4. **Tools & APIs**
   - OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude
   - Jira API (atlassian-python-api)
   - Email integrations (SMTP/SendGrid)
   - Vector store for document retrieval
5. **Orchestration Framework**
   - LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows
Sample Flow: PDF to Jira
1. Upload policy PDF
2. IngestorAgent extracts text
3. ContextAgent identifies context elements
4. RequirementAgent generates structured requirements
5. ComplianceAgent validates alignment with policies
6. TraceAgent logs all steps
7. Result pushed to Jira
Security & Compliance
- PII redaction & anonymization pre-step
- Audit logs stored in append-only DB or JSON
- Role-based SME validation loop
- Secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environmentsBenefits
- Accelerates requirements capture
- Ensures consistent formatting and compliance
- Maintains traceability and audit readiness
- Reduces manual SME effort by 70%+
MVP Goals
- Upload PDF/email transcript
- Auto-generate 3 user stories + acceptance criteria
- Push to Jira
- Store logs in a dashboard
Compliance Rules
|---|---|---|---|---|
| R1 | All unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs) must be ingested and interpreted by the AI
system. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R2 | The AI system must generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R3 | The AI system must ensure regulatory compliance and traceability. | Legal | High | GDPR,
ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R4 | The AI system's outputs must be integrated into enterprise tools like Jira. | Operational |
High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R5 | The AI system must have a secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environments. | Security | High
| ISO/IEC 27001, GDPR |
| R6 | The AI system must redact and anonymize PII data. | Security | High | GDPR |
| R7 | The AI system must store audit logs in an append-only DB or JSON. | Security | High | ISO/IEC
27001, GDPR || R8 | The AI system must have a role-based SME validation loop. | Operational | Medium | ISO/IEC
27001 |
| R9 | The AI system must reduce manual SME effort by at least 70%. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R10 | The AI system must be able to upload PDF/email transcript. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R11 | The AI system must auto-generate at least 3 user stories + acceptance criteria. |
Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |
| R12 | The AI system must push generated user stories to Jira. | Operational | High | ISO/IEC 27001
|
| R13 | The AI system must store logs in a dashboard. | Data | High | ISO/IEC 27001 |

- The project "Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions" aims to automate the process of gathering, documenting and validating requirements using intelligent agents. 
- These LLM-powered agents will interpret context from unstructured data, extract relevant information, generate requirements, ensure compliance, and integrate outputs with enterprise tools like Jira.
- High-level components include an input layer, various agents (ingestor, parser, context, requirement, compliance, validation, trace), memory & reasoning, OpenAI tools & APIs, and an orchestration framework.
- A sample flow from PDF to Jira would involve multiple agents processing and validating the data, with all steps logged, and results pushed to Jira.
- Implementation ensures PII redaction & anonymization, maintains secure audit logs, incorporates a role-based validation loop, and can be securely deployed on-prem or in VPC environments.
- The solution aims to accelerate requirements capture, ensure consistent formatting and compliance, maintain traceability and audit readiness, and reduce manual effort by 70%+.
- An MVP would include the capability to upload a PDF/email transcript, auto-generate 3 user stories with acceptance criteria, push this to Jira, and store logs in a dashboard.

**Action items**
- Develop and integrate various agents that handle different tasks like the extraction of text from source files, parsing of relevant content, extraction of context elements, generation & validation of requirements, regulatory compliance, and logging of transformations.
- Implement a layer of memory and reasoning.
- Leverage OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude, Jira API, Email integrations, and Vector store for document retrieval.
- Implement an orchestration framework such as LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows.
- Prepare the MVP as per the specified goals.
- Ensure compliance with all listed rules.

**Blockers**
- Compliance and security concerns might slow down the development process, as these require careful and thoughtful implementation.
